metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9532 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the writeBufferToSeparateStrips function in tiffcrop.cin LibTIFF before 4.0.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds read) via a crafted tif file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9532` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.6').
